definition: slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: They should be probated for first offenses.
sentences.chinese: 他們是初犯，應當緩刑處理。

sentences.english: California Penal Code 488 - small fine, community service, restitution and 3 years of informal probation.
sentences.chinese: 小額罰款，社區服務，賠償，及3年非正規緩刑。

sentences.english: The court heared a report from the probation officer.
sentences.chinese: 法院聽取了監督緩刑官員的彙報。

sentences.english: But police-killers are unlikely candidates for reprieve.
sentences.chinese: 但殺害警察的人很可能不在緩刑的候選之列。

sentences.english: However, Magistrate Tong ruled out suspending the sentence owing to the seriousness of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 不過，裁判官由於罪行的嚴重性不判決緩刑。

sentences.english: Unless there is a reprieve the condemned man will hang on Friday .
sentences.chinese: 除非緩刑，那個被宣判的人將於星期五被處絞刑。

sentences.english: They agreed to a few days off without pay and two years of probation.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們決定禁止他工作數日同時停薪，並緩刑兩年。

sentences.english: Article 74 Suspension of sentence shall not be applied to recidivists.
sentences.chinese: 第七十四條對於累犯，不適用緩刑。

sentences.english: The group has asked for a stay of execution for all the Aum cultists.
sentences.chinese: 該教團已申請對所有奧姆真理教信徒執行緩刑。

sentences.english: The cost of the reprieve was high, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，緩刑成本是高昂的。

sentences.english: He is placed in the care of the probation service to monitor and supervise him.
sentences.chinese: 他已獲緩刑，在此期間應受監督和管理。

sentences.english: The prisoner condemned to death was reprieved for two years.
sentences.chinese: 判死刑的罪犯被緩刑兩年執行。

sentences.english: When something is on probation, it becomes an easy target.
sentences.chinese: 當某項目被判‘緩刑’時，它很容易成爲攻擊目標。

sentences.english: He said that cuts to frontline probation services would only make the situation worse.
sentences.chinese: 他表示這種緩刑方式只能使得情況變得更糟糕。

sentences.english: He also has the power to issue pardons and reprieves.
sentences.chinese: 其亦可頒佈特赧或緩刑令。

sentences.english: And even the opposition newspapers have given the president a temporary reprieve from their barbs.
sentences.chinese: 即使是反對派報紙給主席從他們的倒鉤暫時緩刑。

definition: to reduce penalty/shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence
to judge a case/to render a verdict/verdict
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
